symptoms.name: Vaginal discharge
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be copious, yellow-green, frothy, with fishy odor
symptoms.pattern: May be present in over 50% of women; can be purulent

symptoms.name: Painful urination (dysuria)
symptoms.pattern: Common in women; can also occur in men

symptoms.name: Urethral discharge/urethritis
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be transient, frothy, or purulent
symptoms.pattern: More common in men, often asymptomatic; can cause dysuria and frequency

symptoms.name: Strawberry cervix
symptoms.pattern: Punctate, red spots on the cervix; seen in some women

symptoms.name: Cystitis
symptoms.pattern: Can occur in both men and women

physical_findings: Inflammation and edema in labia (in women)
Punctate, red “strawberry” spots on vaginal walls and cervix (in women)

lab_values.Wet mount microscopy: Presence of trichomonads (pear-shaped with flagella, often motile)
lab_values.NAATs: Detection of T. vaginalis nucleic acid

required: Presence of symptoms suggestive of trichomoniasis (vaginal discharge, dysuria, etc.)
Positive diagnostic test for T. vaginalis (e.g., wet mount microscopy, NAATs, culture)
